DOC.brief_summary: SUBJECTS : All participant RADIEL-study ( 2008-2011 ) deliver ( n=535 ) , invite follow-up study , child ( age 3-5 year ) father . The investigation carry two separate visit . The father receive mail questionnaire OVERALL OBJECTIVES : 1 . To determine long-term effectiveness lifestyle intervention high risk woman offspring 1. reduce incidence T2DM cardiovascular disease risk factor 2. prevent obesity 3. biomarkers 4. genetic epigenetics marker . 2 . To study association maternal diet pregnancy metabolic marker offspring age 3-5 year . 3 . To study association maternal exercise habit pregnancy metabolic marker offspring age 3-5 year . 4 . To study association maternal ) glucose-insulin metabolism b ) lipid metabolism c ) adipoinsulinar axis ) inflammatory marker birth size later health outcome mother offspring . 5 . To study association gut microbiota marker offspring health 6 . To study cost effectiveness intervention . METHODS : Maternal measurement 1 . Height , weight , waist hip circumference 2 . Blood pressure , pulse 3 . Body fat percentage 4 . Blood test e.g . marker glucose metabolism lipid , vitamin D , Calcium bone marker , DNA sample inflammation marker 5 . Fecal hair sample 6 . Diurnal salivary cortisol assessment 7 . Background questionnaire : socioeconomic health-related background 8 . Health-related quality life ( 15-D ) . 9 . 3-day food diary exercise diary 10 . ArmBand ( acceleration sensor ) , assessment physical activity sleep 7 day 11 . Psychological questionnaire 12 . Pulse wave velocity ( PWV ) assess 13 . Advanced glycation endproducts - marker cardiovascular health assess Paternal measurement 1 . Background questionnaire ( incl . height , weight , age ) 2 .
